author: Robert Leonardo
comment: Spouse and I were using an alternate app for a few years. Due to lack of expressed wants from customers and improvements from that one, we moved to this app. Cinnamon is very impressive. Highly customizable and has many of the features we were looking for.  Only thing I would like to see in the future builds would be a user guide within that features tips on ease of use.  A web browser interface option for our account would be awesome too.  Well done to the developer.

author: Anthony Pukal
comment: This app has been very helpful! When shopping I use it every time due to its ease of use, intuitive user interface, and overall great way to make a list and know what's what. I used Google Keep for a shopping list before this, but Cinnamon has blown Keep out of the water. Love it.

author: Hel Lo
comment: I've tried a few different grocery/pantry apps and didn't like them for one reason or another (seems often they either make things overly complicated or they don't allow for ENOUGH detail). This one, however, seems very intuitive and easy to use with just enough features that I don't get option-overload. Also has a very lovely UI!

author: Melissa Hulst
comment: Love this app - tried lots of lists and this is by far the most convenient and beautiful. Would love an option to have price for each individual item show up in buy list so I can compare without having to click on it (unless I'm just missing that option!)

author: Joey Tripp
comment: This is the best shopping list app out there. I have tried all of them but they do not have the features I wanted. I cannot tell you how much I love this app. When I plan a shopping trip I always use this app and I use it to keep inventory of my household items. Gary, please keep this app going with updates! You made an amazing one.

author: YK KY
comment: I love this app. Simple to use, allows me to keep a record of my pantry, which in turn means that I no longer buy a jar of cinnamon when I already have two in the cupboard! Lot less food waste as a result too. This app saves me money.
This app continually locks up. It's suppose to make your shopping experience more efficient, it doesn't. I spend more time trying to get the app to work than it would take to write a paper list.

author: Rune Koldborg Jensen
comment: Hands down, the best shopping list experience for one handed use while shopping. Can't find a certain item? Swipe it to your 'Later' section, and it'll be on your shopping list next time you go shopping.  I would like some better syncing and sharing - current implementation is less than obvious. Also adding items via Google Assistant would be amazing.

author: Susie Cox
comment: What a WONDERFUL grocery shopping app! Simple yet elegant! I appreciate the ability to create an unlimited number of categories and the sorting feature is terrific for arranging the categories according to the store's lay-out. Thank you to the developers for creating this little gem!

author: Abhinav Aggarwal
comment: Looked brilliant but no category wise sorting during adding items puts this off completely,  Why not bulk add delete in the default lists, what's the logic of hiding them. It doesn't make sense to add individual items then edit their category and so on?

author: Lee Hamilton
comment: This app has a really nice material designed GUI. The one thing stopping me from using it is the lack of Amazon Echo/Google Assistant support. I'd love to be able to add stuff using my Google home!

author: Chelce Hessler
comment: This app is the only one I have been able to get to work with both Android Wear 2.0 and Google Assistant (through AutoVoice and Tasker) since Google wrecked compatibility with Keep. The app is simple and the design is clean; it has a substantial wealth of features but does not feel too complicated for daily use. My lists consistently sync from my phone to my watch, so I don't have to worry about forgetting items due to lag.The reasons I gave it four stars instead of five are that the Wear app is a little buggy (it switches lists after screen timeout), and I wish there were a few more options for customizing the aesthetic (even just the ability to change the list background to colors other than Light/Dark would be sufficient).

author: Sean Alcos
comment: What do you have in your pantry? What do you need to buy? What ingredients do you need for a recipe that you always make? What toiletries do I need to replenish? This app organizes your household and your shopping list. You can use the basic list or get more detailed with cost. Up to you. Highly recommend this app. Google Keep is for simple lists. This app understands the cycle of the household: buy, run-out, add to shopping list, buy, run-out, add to shopping list, buy, ...

author: Loris Stavrinides
comment: Its food so far and useful. Love the UI! But why after some time my items from the Next Time list go back to my Buy List? If that's how is supposed to work we should get the option to disable it or control the time before are moved back.

author: Liz Ramon
comment: Intuitive and exactly what I was looking for. I love seeing grocery items I've purchased in my pantry and when I've used them up, I can delete or send to my list to purchase again. Plus the bundles are really useful. We buy some items every week. Now I don't have to think about those items individually, just add the bundle to my shopping list with one swipe. I can even adjust categories for the grocery store I use so that my list is sorted by the sections of the store, and I get everything I need before moving on. No back tracking- hooray! That part does take some time to set up on your own, but worth it. I'm still using the free version, but am considering premium to remove ads soon.

author: Kam M
comment: After trying most of the more well known shopping lists, I've returned to Cinnamon. This is the best app for me, the swipe between lists is unique and intuitive, the UI is simple, attractive & customisable, & the ability to add price & units helps with planning. Really well done. Thanks

author: Jake Schmidt
comment: Better than all the other grocery list apps. It's the only one that figured out how to manage pantry inventory / need to buy / in cart list dynamics.

author: dianne rosario
comment: Easy to use. Has all the basics. Beautiful UI. No clutter. No unnecessary bells and whistles. Best app for grocery listing!

author: Sarick Shah
comment: Pls add expiration date tracking

author: Harold Meyer
comment: Good app, but I miss the bar code reader. It was a great time saver.

author: Vincent Westberg
comment: Servers have nothing to do with premium don't force people to buy

author: Edgar Ruiz
comment: Gary Wong, this app is incredible! Keep up the great work. Thank you for this!

author: Sheryl Bekstrom
comment: Nothing works.

author: Pretty Pleats Please Fashion Blog
comment: No Updates Since March 2017

author: Ian Beckett
comment: doesn't support Google home.

author: Emma Bucket
comment: Made my shopping trip (and compiling my list when I NEVER seem to have paper) a breeze! Only thing I would love to see the addition of is the ability to keep a list of coupons and apply them to items, or simply have the ability to enter a discount on the item as a field similar to the unit price field. Great app; I'm recommending to everyone!

author: John Doe
comment: This app is really good for grocery shopping 1. Allow us to duplicate a list for us to compare one store vs another or something like that 2. Allow us to copy and paste the list wherever, not having to send the entire list, but parts of the list as well 3. Please add the option to make it so when we put an item in the cart list, when we search for an item and that item has a few letters of it, please make it so it shows that that item is in the cart list. For example, searching for "juice" will bring up apple, lemon, and fruit juice for me, and if apple juice was in my cart list, that'd be really helpful if it showed underneath it that it was in my cart, maybe add an icon or something too. 4. Add a true dark theme please

author: Kearstin Lauer
comment: I love this app! The only thing I would love to see is to be able to add items and then add the item to a category, instead of grouping all of my added items into an uncategorized section.

author: Niclas Fagerholm
comment: Really easy to use and well implemented material design. Best grocery list app, but no sharing for other people.

author: Kelleen Louchart
comment: I love this app! It makes it so easy to keep track of my shopping lists. Excellent job!

author: Tamal Dhara
comment: Please make a INR

author: Robin van de Griend
comment: Love the interface and usability

author: BRENDA HAMILTON
comment: Awesome

author: David Brookes
comment: I have tried a lot of different shopping list apps and this is the one that makes the most sense and works best for me and my wife. The concept of the Pantry is very handy for ensuring that I don't buy something we only recently bought. Hope to see more enhancements in future!
title: Flawless

author: Paul Stroud
comment: Easy to share the shopping list (or lists) with others.  Updates very quickly.
title: Love it

author: joe joe
comment: Simple and effective. No ads to clutter the screen.

author: Barb Strohl
comment: Barcode scanning isn't working currently.               When I switched to Android I tried every grocery list app before settling on this one. We have used it for a couple years and we easily work off of the same shopping list. I still miss some things I used to have but this makes up for it on other options.
title: Keeps us in sync

author: Claudia Reeves
comment: With the premium edition, my husband and I can each add to the list and whoever stops at the store can  shop for both of us. However, if you are in the U.S. only metric units are available. If I had realised that I would have looked for a different app.
title: Great for multiple metric shoppers

author: Fredrik Ekelund
comment: This is probably one of the best functioning apps I've had on my Android phone. Initially I found it to be a bit bloated on the feature side, but after using it for a few months, I found some of those features very useful, and the others aren't getting in the way. Great design, paying to get rid of the ads is clearly worth it!
title: Simple, beautiful design

author: Katra Cantrell
comment: Simple, clean design that works exactly as it should. It's easy to use, but there's some complexity if you want it. I'm the person who always forgets ONE item when shopping at the end of the day, and Cinnamon's got my back.
